page.title: 07NORTH PEMBROKE - HOUSING
page.content: Pembroke is a very old town which grew in importance in Norman times. Today, it is combined with Pembroke Dock and has a population of 14500. The part of north Pembroke within our block has very few old houses. There is part of a council estate about 30 years old at The Green. There is a modern private housing estate at Whitehall Drive and an estate at Buttermilk Lane which used to be owned by the Army as officers' quarters but these are now privately owned. Just south of this is a new council estate off Devon Drive which has many terraced houses. There are also some private older houses at Golden Hill. Of 17 local schoolchildren inter- viewed, 9 lived in terraced houses, 3 in bungalows and 5 in semis or detatched houses.
